title: Welcome to Arcandina
landingPageTitle: Arcandina Official - Environmental Education for Children
landingPageDescription: Arcandina is the leading platform for environmental education for children, featuring audiovisual content about the conservation of Río San Pedro and the importance of environmental best practices. Meet characters like Jagui, Cori, Ratasura, Tucán, and Guardián Verde who guide children in their learning journey. Perfect for searches related to environmental conservation.
notFoundPageDescription: Sorry, we couldn't find the page you're looking for
aboutUsText3: Pack your bags because we're about to set off on an unforgettable journey—we're going to have so much fun! Onboard the Arcandina, we'll sail through rivers, lakes, and seas across the world, facing villains like Avariciosus Maximus and Ratasura, who pollute the water with plastics, oils, chemicals, and textiles. Join this great adventure to protect water and safeguard our planet!
aboutUsText5: Do you want to know more about Arcandina?
aboutUsText8: I'm Cori, a sea lion from the Galápagos. I'm always watching over the mysteries of the sea and everything that connects us to water. Today, I want to share something super exciting with you. Did you know you can learn so many curious things without leaving your home? For instance, have you heard about plastic islands? You'd be amazed to learn how they form and how we can stop them from growing. You can also discover simple yet powerful ways to help rivers no matter where you are.
aboutUsText9: There are many ways to learn how to care for water: adventure-filled videos, fun podcasts that inspire you to create your own stories, and magazines packed with information to turn you into an expert. Join this mission, and together, let's protect rivers and water sources!

rotaryText3: Choose your mission to save water
rotaryText5: For more content from Arcandina & Rotary
arkText2: In the Arcandina, you'll have access to an exclusive selection of videos and podcasts, including all episodes of the miniseries developed in collaboration with Rotary and much more. Additionally, you’ll find a library with magazines and stories that allow you to explore fascinating topics. You'll also be able to discover the most innovative projects and workshops from Arcandina, presenting valuable information accompanied by graphics, infographics, and educational material. Dive into the ark's content and be part of this amazing educational adventure!
footerTitle4: Follow us on our social media
mariaElenaDescription: Educator, children's story writer, television scriptwriter and director, expert in communication and environmental education, with experience in developing audiovisual products and television programs for children and youth. In 2003, María Elena Ordóñez was named one of the 20 most outstanding Social Entrepreneurs worldwide by the Schwab Foundation of the World Economic Forum. In 2000, she was selected as a fellow by the Ashoka organization for social entrepreneurship and as a Social Leader by the Avina Foundation. She was recognized among the 40 exceptional women of Ecuador by Vistazo Magazine and among the 12 most outstanding Ecuadorians of 2002 by El Universo newspaper in Ecuador.
pabloDescription: Expert in multimedia communication and strategic communication planning, film director, photographer, and writer. He has served as a Communications Program Officer for Johns Hopkins University. Consultant and advisor for USAID, UNESCO, and UNICEF. President of the Arcandina Foundation and director of the Cimerron Cinema company in New York. Director and co-producer of the documentary series “Africa: the beat goes on,” about the contributions of Afro-descendants to the continent's culture and identity. His documentary Flags, Feathers and Lies was selected by the Library of Congress of the United States.
revistaDescription: This magazine, presented by Arcandina and Rotary, invites readers to dive into essential topics on water conservation and river preservation. Through educational articles and inspiring projects, it explores the importance of protecting our water resources and the biodiversity that depends on them. With a focus on environmental conservation and responsible water management, this publication aims to raise awareness and inspire actions toward a more sustainable future. We invite you to read it and discover how, together, we can protect our rivers and ensure clean water for everyone!
workingPageDescription: This section is currently under development. Please check back soon to discover new content and features. Thank you for your patience!

landingPage.jaguiDescription: Visit with Jagüi the projects and workshops we have conducted, along with all their materials.
landingPage.antonellaDescription: Go to the homepage to see the latest Arcandina news and important instructions we have for you.
landingPage.tucanDescription: Read along with Tucán all the stories and readings we have for you in the reading corner.
landingPage.guardianDescription: Watch all the audiovisual content we have for you in the Video Zone, along with the Green Guardian, the leader of Arcandina.
landingPage.coriDescription: Listen to our podcasts with Cori, the ocean guardian, in our podcast studio.

emptyVideoCardDescription: Don't miss the next episode! Follow us on social media to be the first to know when it's available.
